text:
Hi all! I am looking to beef up my writing portfolio with a sample or two of long-form writing -- case studies and white papers. My niche is web and digital technologies and I usually draw upon my 15-year experience working as a web manager for nonprofits in my writings. I realize case studies and white papers require substantial research and information and might even require interviewing a subject matter expert.

Starting from scratch I am drawing a blank on what to write about in my sample. I am seeking feedback and inspiration from content marketing managers on what would be good topics in the web and digital niche that would catch their attention and also what might be good potential sources of research, stats and information. Thanks for any feedback!

elements.text:
Hi all! I am looking to beef up my writing portfolio with a sample or two of long-form writing -- case studies and white papers. My niche is web and digital technologies and I usually draw upon my 15-year experience working as a web manager for nonprofits in my writings. I realize case studies and white papers require substantial research and information and might even require interviewing a subject matter expert.

Starting from scratch I am drawing a blank on what to write about in my sample. I am seeking feedback and inspiration from content marketing managers on what would be good topics in the web and digital niche that would catch their attention and also what might be good potential sources of research, stats and information. Thanks for any feedback!

text: Why don’t you start with what you know? You could create a case study by interviewing one of your past or current clients. The case study could be about the work you helped them produce or ask them to write a case study about one of the campaigns they did that went really well. For a white paper, you could write something about a topic your ideal audience would care about. Following the nonprofit trend you could write a paper about five campaigns that went really well in 2020 or a paper about trends for 2021.

elements.text: Why don’t you start with what you know? You could create a case study by interviewing one of your past or current clients. The case study could be about the work you helped them produce or ask them to write a case study about one of the campaigns they did that went really well. For a white paper, you could write something about a topic your ideal audience would care about. Following the nonprofit trend you could write a paper about five campaigns that went really well in 2020 or a paper about trends for 2021.

text: Once you have some good samples of the types of content you can produce, you can still show those to whatever client comes your way. You’ll likely write about a variety of topics during your time writing case studies and white papers.

elements.text: Once you have some good samples of the types of content you can produce, you can still show those to whatever client comes your way. You’ll likely write about a variety of topics during your time writing case studies and white papers.

text: Thanks Amanda for the ideas and feedback! Recent big projects I led and worked with clients with are a web redesign and a site build from scratch. I am starting to get my mind whirring with ideas now. :-)

elements.text: Thanks Amanda for the ideas and feedback! Recent big projects I led and worked with clients with are a web redesign and a site build from scratch. I am starting to get my mind whirring with ideas now. :-)

text: I agree with Amanda! And maybe you already have this in your portfolio, but I was just talking to a friend who hires a lot of “creative talent” for big tech, and he was telling me that what stands out to him is when people include personal/passion projects. Always good to include examples of work you want to be doing, but don’t be afraid to include something that seems off-the-wall, but really speaks to who you are as a writer. He’s seen people include portions of spec scripts for TV shows, short stories, lifestyle articles, etc., and he says it shows that they enjoy writing and can think outside of the box.

He’s seen people include portions of spec scripts for TV shows, short stories, lifestyle articles, etc., and he says it shows that they enjoy writing and can think outside of the box.

text: Thanks Ashly! That is a good idea to include passion projects. Glad to hear this info on what makes writers and creatives stand out to people who do hiring

text: <@U01HEQWRG0G> do you have examples of blogs you like? It seems the functionality is ok, so you might be able to do a short-term fix by reskinning it and get the look and feel closer to what you want
